font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The law of cause and\neffect, action and reaction, the law of karma is an integral part of\nspirituality.&nbsp; It gives us a basis on\nwhich to make right choices and create a beautiful future for ourselves and the\nworld around us.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta says that vairagya,\nor dispassion, is the one thing that can change man\u2019s destiny\u2014it did NOT say tyaga,\nrenunciation. Renouncing one\u2019s family is not vairagya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">True vairagya refers to\nan internal state of mind rather than to external lifestyle and can be\npracticed equally well by one engaged in family life and career as it can be by\na renunciate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya does not mean\nsuppression or developing repulsion for material objects. By the application of\nvivek (spiritual discrimination or discernment) to life experience, the\naspirant gradually develops a strong attraction for the inner spiritual source\nof fulfillment and happiness and limited attachments fall away naturally.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-b-wuxHXPk3c/VzyPnty2CEI/AAAAAAABInE/2cXtwIOquzEsbHlB7z68YoqyfKjswqMhACLcB/s1600/imacceges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"257\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-b-wuxHXPk3c/VzyPnty2CEI/AAAAAAABInE/2cXtwIOquzEsbHlB7z68YoqyfKjswqMhACLcB/s400/imacceges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Balance is maintained between the inner spiritual state and one's external life\nthrough the practice of seeing all limited entities as expressions of the one\nCosmic Consciousness or Brahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term vair\u0101gya\nappears three times in the Bhagavad Gita (6.35, 13.8, 18.52) where it is\nrecommended as a key means for bringing control to the restless mind. It is\nalso the main topic of Mok\u1e63op\u0101ya or Yoga Vasistha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya must tbe born\nof discrimination or Viveka. &nbsp;Turn the\nmind away from shallow sensual objects. You will develop Vairagya. Vairagya\nborn of discrimination or Viveka is the premonitory symptom of spiritual\ndevelopment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lead a life of\ndispassion, self-control, purity, selfless service, cosmic love. Develop the\nhabit of taking the right point of view, right thinking, right feeling, right\nacting, with right mental attitude or Bhav. Practice devotion, yoga and\nmeditation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya is purely an internal mental state. A man may remain in\nthe busy world amidst various luxuries, women and wealth, and yet he may\npossess perfect Vairagya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya is of two\nkinds viz., Karanavairagya (on account of miseries \u2013hospital/ jail stay is a\ngreat leveler ) and Viveka-purvaka-Vairagya (on account of discrimination\nbetween the real and the unreal).&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Nt3C-5L0Qz8/VzyP5pk-n7I/AAAAAAABInM/BKSdvXXoo5w-RCTGt4K-YDGY0sGaXq0iwCLcB/s1600/ima7kfes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"226\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Nt3C-5L0Qz8/VzyP5pk-n7I/AAAAAAABInM/BKSdvXXoo5w-RCTGt4K-YDGY0sGaXq0iwCLcB/s400/ima7kfes.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mind of a man who has got the former type\nof Vairagya is simply waiting for a chance to get back the things that have\nbeen given up or lost. As soon as the first opportunity occurs, the man gets a\ndownfall and goes back to his former state.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But the other man who\nhas given up objects on account of deep enquiry and Viveka, on account of the\nillusory nature of objects, will have spiritual advancement. He will not have\nany downfall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samadhi comes by itself\nwhen the Yogic student is fully established in perfect Vairagya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya is the\nopposite of Raga, or desire. It is dispassion or non-attachment. It is\nindifference to sensual objects herein and hereafter. Vairagya thins out the\nfatty sensual mind. It turns the mind inward (Antarmukh Vritti). This is the\nmost important qualification for an aspirant. It is the one and the only means\nto enter into Nirvikalpa Samadhi.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-87H5EkTb9Ek/VzyQWgSXUWI/AAAAAAABInU/8NQ8fmOUGv0R9SWM4dEP_M4zRxu8rw_gACLcB/s1600/imagerhs.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-87H5EkTb9Ek/VzyQWgSXUWI/AAAAAAABInU/8NQ8fmOUGv0R9SWM4dEP_M4zRxu8rw_gACLcB/s400/imagerhs.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya that is born\nof discrimination is lasting and steady. If you seriously think of the various\nkinds of pain in this Samsara such as birth, death, worries, depression,\nsuffering, disease, loss, hostility, disappointment, fear, etc., if you\nunderstand intelligently the defects of sensual life (Dosha Drishti), and the\ntransitory and perishable nature of all objects of the world, Vairagya will\nimmediately dawn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Drishta-anursravika\nvishaya-vitrishnasya vasikarasamjna vairagyam-That particular state of mind\nwhich manifests itself in one who does not hanker after objects seen or heard\nand in which one is conscious of having controlled or mastered those objects is\nnon-attachment.\" (Patanjali's Yoga-Sutras: 1-15)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are four stages\nin Vairagya:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1) Yatamana:- This is\nan attempt not to allow the mind to run into sensual grooves;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(2) Vyatireka :-In this\nstage some objects are attracting you and you are endeavouring to cut off the\nattachment and attraction. Slowly Vairagya develops for these objects also.\nThen the Vairagya matures. When some objects tempt and delude you, you should\nruthlessly avoid them. You will have to develop Vairagya for these tempting\nobjects and it must also mature. In this stage you are conscious of your degree\nof Vairagya towards different objects;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3) Ekendriya:-The\nsenses stand still and are subdued, but the mind has either Raga or Dvesha for\nobjects. Mind is, in other words, the only sense that functions independently;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(4) Vasirara :-The\nobjects no longer tempt you. They cause no attraction. The senses are perfectly\nquiet. The mind also is free from likes and dislikes (Raga and Dvesha). Then\nyou get supremacy or independence. Now you are conscious of your supremacy.\nWithout Vairagya no spiritual progress is possible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(5) Paravairagya :-In\nthis highest stage of Vairagya. In this state, it is free from the qualities of\nthe gunas and the sadhaka no longer worried about himself.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6Dyq0UeO8m8/VzyQiZfdYDI/AAAAAAABInY/1g26EnW9Hs4G0MYFJPJa97WwZYQYU7fZQCLcB/s1600/imagdd4s.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6Dyq0UeO8m8/VzyQiZfdYDI/AAAAAAABInY/1g26EnW9Hs4G0MYFJPJa97WwZYQYU7fZQCLcB/s400/imagdd4s.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya is of three\nkinds viz., dull (Manda), intense (Tivra) and very intense (Tivratara). Dull\nVairagya cannot help you much in the attainment of your goal<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya does not mean\nabandoning social duties and responsibilities of life. &nbsp;It does not mean detachment from the world. It\ndoes not mean a austere life in the solitary caves of the Himalayas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya is mental\ndetachment. He identifies himself every moment of his life with the witnessing\nconsciousness that is present in pleasure and in pain, in joy and in sorrow, in\ncensure and in praise, in honour and in dishonour, in all states of life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Self-discipline is Sattvika-ty\u0101ga,\nduring the course of which exercise one has control over negative emotions and\nbehaviours such as anger, greed and pride.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bhagavad Gita\nprojects action to serve as steps on the path of spiritual ascent, as an\neffective means to purify the mind through diligently cultivated mental\ndiscipline in action; the true fruit of Tyaga is an elevating sense of peace\nand fulfillment, even if it entails a bit of physical discomfort<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Real Tyaga or Sannyasa\nis absolute renunciation of all Vasanas and destruction of the heart knot\n(ignorance),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In ordinary Vairagya\nthere is a trace of Vasanas and desires. But in Para-Vairagya all Vasanas,\nSamskaras and desires are fried in toto. In Para-Vairagya there will be no\ndesire at all. Perfect desirelessness is Para-Vairagya. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9t1itwyy_rw/VzyJSkhSl7I/AAAAAAABImM/10NFfvhxGkEdqaWGYdq7mgzktvyIz7ZkgCLcB/s1600/downloatd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"391\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9t1itwyy_rw/VzyJSkhSl7I/AAAAAAABImM/10NFfvhxGkEdqaWGYdq7mgzktvyIz7ZkgCLcB/s400/downloatd.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Objects fall away\nfrom the abstinent man, leaving the longing behind. But his longing also\nceases, who sees the Supreme.\" ( Bhagwad Gita 11-59&nbsp; 4000 BC).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The delights that\nare contact-born are, verily, wombs of pain, for they have a beginning and an\nending, O Kaunteya, not in them would rejoice the wise.\" ( Ch. V-22 Bhagawad\nGita )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indifference to the\nobjects of the senses, and also absence of egoism, insight into the pain and\nevil of birth and death, old age and sickness.\" ( Ch. XIII-8 Bhagawad Gita\n).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"That which from\nthe union of the senses with their objects is at first as nectar, but in the\nend is like venom.\" ( Ch. XVIII-38 Bhagwad Gita )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indriyaartheshu\nvairaagyamanahankaara eva cha;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Janmamrityujaraavyaadhi\nduhkhadoshaanu darshanam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indifference to the\nobjects of the senses, also absence of egoism, reflection on the evil in birth,\ndeath, old age, sickness and pain (this is declared to be knowledge). &nbsp;<b>Bhagavad\nGita</b> (13:9)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Always make the mind\nunderstand<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cCravings cause\nincessant trouble in many different ways. These cravings are the seeds of this\nSamsara\" (Yoga-Vasishtha).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-7KbYdbxhx-M/VzyJkr2_9dI/AAAAAAABImQ/H7yv1SrToGAkTyKTLyyDvSfWjjMi9QQzwCLcB/s1600/imagges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-7KbYdbxhx-M/VzyJkr2_9dI/AAAAAAABImQ/H7yv1SrToGAkTyKTLyyDvSfWjjMi9QQzwCLcB/s400/imagges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two currents of the\nmind viz., Raga and Dvesha (attraction and repulsion) constitute world or\nSamsara. The mind gets intensely attached to pleasant objects through\nattraction because it derives pleasure.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wherever there is sensation of\npleasure, the mind gets glued ( addicted porn/ drugs ) , as it were, to the\nobject that gives pleasure. This is what is called attachment. This only brings\nbondage and pain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When either object is\nwithdrawn or perishes, the mind gets unspeakable pain. Attraction is the root\ncause of human sufferings. The mind runs from those objects ( say drugs )which\ngive pain. Attraction and pleasure, repulsion and pain coexist.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A worldly man\nis a slave of these two mighty and devastating currents. He is tossed about\nhither and thither like a piece of straw. He smiles when he gets pleasures, he\nweeps when he gets pain. He clings to pleasant objects, he runs away from\nobjects that cause pain.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-BIuVDCyEdyk/VzyQwRhAFHI/AAAAAAABIng/DUM0Nqua1RAALUEryr-dxNhFCGZU6a81gCLcB/s1600/imgyooages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-BIuVDCyEdyk/VzyQwRhAFHI/AAAAAAABIng/DUM0Nqua1RAALUEryr-dxNhFCGZU6a81gCLcB/s1600/imgyooages.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern civilisation is\nonly another name for sensual enjoyment. Bimbettes attend page 3 parties or\ndrag a long gown on the red carpet of Cannes. The sincere aspirant will\nresolutely turn his back to all these sorts of shallow ego laden pleasures . He\nwill treat them all as poison or shit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Raga binds one to\nsamsara; vairagya liberates from bondage. Vairagya thins out the fatty sensual\nmind. It turns the mind inward. Vairagya is the most important qualification\nfor a spiritual aspirant. Without it, no spiritual life is possible.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2TVaCWela5Q/VzyQ6PND3qI/AAAAAAABInk/nZs5gbeSlvsvTkb4y4sWdyFmVl9LsBTPACLcB/s1600/imaget9es.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"310\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-2TVaCWela5Q/VzyQ6PND3qI/AAAAAAABInk/nZs5gbeSlvsvTkb4y4sWdyFmVl9LsBTPACLcB/s400/imaget9es.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Practice (abhyasa) and\nnon-attachment (vairagya) are the two core principles on which the entire\nsystem of Yoga rests. Abhyasa means having an attitude of persistent effort to\nattain and maintain a state of stable tranquility.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-c-XUqfYHWXY/VzyJv_CJhII/AAAAAAABImU/vWtkboV8kjk4U4j7BpLIUdBfiIIGCGngACLcB/s1600/kriya_yggoga_flow.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"226\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-c-XUqfYHWXY/VzyJv_CJhII/AAAAAAABImU/vWtkboV8kjk4U4j7BpLIUdBfiIIGCGngACLcB/s640/kriya_yggoga_flow.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abhyasa means cultivating\nthe lifestyle, actions, speech, and thoughts, as well as the spiritual\npractices that lead in the positive direction (rather than going in the\nopposite direction, away from the positive, and towards the negative).&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It means\nmaking decisions on the basis of what will bring greater tranquility or peace\nof mind, as these are the preparation for the deeper, subtler practices leading\nto Self-realization.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cF1pYsj8amw/VzyRED3NQTI/AAAAAAABIns/UEsBIVtWiegiEq1wCgUupaysUJ4hIhMIQCLcB/s1600/imf4ages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cF1pYsj8amw/VzyRED3NQTI/AAAAAAABIns/UEsBIVtWiegiEq1wCgUupaysUJ4hIhMIQCLcB/s1600/imf4ages.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vairagya/Non-attachment\nis about learning to let go of the many attachments, aversions, fears, and\nfalse identities that are clouding the true Self. Vairagya is the practice of\ngradually letting go of the mental colorings that lead one away from the\nspiritual (rather than going in the opposite direction, giving in to the\nattachments and aversions).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To be able to do the\npractices and to cultivate non-attachment, it is necessary to become better and\nbetter at discriminating between what actions, speech, and thoughts take you in\nthe right direction, and those which are a diversion. This discrimination is\nboth a foundation practice and also the subtler tool of the inner journey.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The attitude satkara\ncontains the principles of devotion, sincerity, respect, reverence,\npositiveness, and right choice. As you choose your proper level of practice,\nand decide to do that daily, the attitude will come more easily . That little\nflame starts to grow slowly and consistently into a burning desire to guide\nyour life in the direction of spiritual realization.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FpKN_W4gYq4/VzyRMDuXX6I/AAAAAAABInw/FjjmSJPL7_AhyamILltSXrmDsO09-fkogCLcB/s1600/imtthages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FpKN_W4gYq4/VzyRMDuXX6I/AAAAAAABInw/FjjmSJPL7_AhyamILltSXrmDsO09-fkogCLcB/s400/imtthages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It all rests on\nattention: Throughout the science of Yoga meditation attention is a critical\nprinciple to practice. This sharp, clear, assiduous attention (asevitah) is\nessential if you are to develop the attitude of conviction for practices over a\nlong time, and without a break as described in this sutra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The simplest way of\ndescribing non-attachment is as the process of letting go. We gradually learn\nto let go of our attachments and aversions, systematically moving subtler and\nsubtler through the layers of attachments in the mind.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ZsKZWT5tyng/VzyRhIyj-wI/AAAAAAABIn4/EoZKRtBDG5MvfYH_kSXeoWd33YgquabYACLcB/s1600/imagevyyes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"321\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ZsKZWT5tyng/VzyRhIyj-wI/AAAAAAABIn4/EoZKRtBDG5MvfYH_kSXeoWd33YgquabYACLcB/s400/imagevyyes.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, non-attachment\ngoes beyond this; it is not just a practice of letting go, but is a practice of\nnot taking on in the first place.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non-attachment is not a\nprocess of suppression or repression of wants, wishes, desires, thoughts, or\nemotions. It comes by the ongoing practice of awareness of the existence of\nattachments (kleshas) and gradually letting these weaken.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Non-attachment is not\na case of doing something, but is instead a non-doing sort of thing. It means\nthat your attention does not grab onto that impression in the mind in the first\nplace.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-y7k7sgWnIxw/VzyOWGJD60I/AAAAAAABImk/0wpkDsVaUTE3qaaB5LRbMLRUT_NVVEcFACLcB/s1600/dow5566nload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-y7k7sgWnIxw/VzyOWGJD60I/AAAAAAABImk/0wpkDsVaUTE3qaaB5LRbMLRUT_NVVEcFACLcB/s400/dow5566nload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is what WE create\nthrough our deeds, words, thoughts, actions, etc. It is the realm of cause and\neffect.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-FwhaerO75F0/VzyOrYoNfEI/AAAAAAABIms/fx2ZDql6HVwVrB82SH54QvNZ2rxvHEnrQCLcB/s1600/dow39nload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-FwhaerO75F0/VzyOrYoNfEI/AAAAAAABIms/fx2ZDql6HVwVrB82SH54QvNZ2rxvHEnrQCLcB/s320/dow39nload.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We can change our destiny&nbsp; by\nbeing spiritually aware and willing to follow the laws of the universe in our\ncurrent lifetime.&nbsp; We can meditate, and\nbe aware of our choices.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By yoga and\nmeditation , you can let go of limiting thoughts and beliefs and therefore\nlimiting actions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-sAuz9rKRwHk/VzyOiTvxloI/AAAAAAABImo/C2i18tHciyAs4tP5CdkSDODylt_QXuSigCLcB/s1600/downlo4snad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"286\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-sAuz9rKRwHk/VzyOiTvxloI/AAAAAAABImo/C2i18tHciyAs4tP5CdkSDODylt_QXuSigCLcB/s400/downlo4snad.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3906840923256141321\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_53M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/10607355811790880535\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">billy</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/06/unsung-ozone-for-instant-prevention-and.html?showComment=1371869300401#c3906840923256141321\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 22, 2013 at 8:18 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_53MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nDear Captain Saheeb,<br />\nAs you have mentioned that our Rishis and Maharshis were using their copper lotas to generate ozone.<br />\nSo do you mean Ozone is considered as the Pran-vayu mentioned in our books? Because even in Shri Mad-Bhagawat when Gaurtam rishi is explaining Sankhya-shastra to his mother have mentioned Pran-vayu several times.<br />\nSo I hope if you could put some light on this.<br />\n<br />\nThanks &amp; Regards</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_53BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_53b+seedEQmVD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_52T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_53b+seedEQmVD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_52TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_52TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_52TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_53b+seedEQmVD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_52TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_52TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_53b+seedEQmVD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_52TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_52TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_52TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_53b+seedEQmVD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_52B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4738298782159179177\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_52M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/06/unsung-ozone-for-instant-prevention-and.html?showComment=1371877188589#c4738298782159179177\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 22, 2013 at 10:29 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_52MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi b,<br />\n<br />\nPrana in Sanskrit means, \"life-force\". This vital energy helps the body to maintain good health. Pranavayu is oxygen.<br />\n<br />\nThe Prana absorbed from air includes ozone Prana. This energy can be acquired through deep slow rhythmic diaphragmatic breathing . Ozone present in the early morning air.<br />\n<br />\nPra means highest , Ayama means dimension. Prana vayu operates in connection with the respiratory and circulatory systems.<br />\n<br />\nApana vayu operates in connection with the excretory and reproductive systems.<br />\n<br />\nThe aim of Pranayama is to channelise the vital energy into Ida and Pingala nadis to centralise into Sushumna nadi and help ascend it upwards towards the brain (Sahasrara) whereby the \u201cHighest Consciousness\u201d can be awakened.<br />\n<br />\nRight nostril is connected with Pingala Nadi, which represents the physical energy and body.<br />\n<br />\nWhile chanting OM, the prana generated is magic molecule nitric oxide (MMM).<br />\n<br />\nWhere science stops, spirituality starts.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_53b+seedEQmVD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_53b+seedEQmVD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The soul carries with\nit the samskaras ( mental impressions ) it received during its earthly\nlife.&nbsp; If these samskaras created phobias\nand debilitating thoughts affecting free will in the next life\u2014&nbsp; Yoga is the only answer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contrary to what the\nshallow minded white man insists , Sanatana Dharma does not teach fatalism . In\nfact, Bhagawad Gita is all about BEING IN THE MOMENT and DOING YOUR DUTY ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has been explained\nin Vedanta that&nbsp; we human beings are\npartly free and partly determined. It nonsense to say that fate places\nobstacles in the way of free will.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, the fact\nthat our actions on earth are governed by the law of gravity does not mean that\nwe are frozen in place and cannot move about. &nbsp; It simply means we have free will\nwithin limitations. We can run, for instance, but we cannot fly ( like Rajnikanth\n) .</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism leaves man\nquite free to act, using his own conscience ( which is NOT afforded by any\nother single holy book religion ). Sanatana Dharma just guides and by pointing man\nin the right direction.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindusim does NOT allow\nman to escape responsibility by blaming fate,( for fate is of his own making ),\nnor by blaming God, for He is but the dispenser of fruits in accordance with\nthe merits of actions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism states that we\nare the master of our own destiny. It is for us to make it, to better it or to\nspoil it. &nbsp;This is our privilege. This is\nour responsibility.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Hindus who knows his\nreligion will straight away that Ashtavakra Gita is a FAKE document created and\nbackdated by the white invader. &nbsp;For\nthere is NO wisdom discernible like in our other scriptures. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our ancient wisdom emanated from how our\nmaharishis lived their lives. These supermen did NOT root their happiness on\nsomething they could lose. These wise men took responsibility for the future .\nThey taught us to unlearn and to walk away from negativity. They taught us to witness\nand know ourselves .&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wisdom is to the soul, what health is to the\nphysical boy \u2013 ancient yoga did NOT lose track of this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Universal forces of\nfate, destiny, karma, free will, and the Law of Attraction are all&nbsp; intertwined, <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fate is what is in\nplace at your birth-fate chose your relatives , NOT your friends . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma, and the Law of\nAttraction are all important ingredients of destiny.&nbsp;&nbsp; The key that turns them into destiny, is the\nunique essence of who you are in this lifetime, right here, right now, and how\nit dictates the choices you make using free will.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Astrology, has helped\nthe Hindu in identifying important components of his karma and destiny.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Psychics can see\nglimpses of your soul\u2019s intent, as well as what\u2019s waiting for you down the road\nyou\u2019re traveling now, and suggest alternatives.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Astrology can show broad karma, the basic\ningredients of your character and the timing of pivotal events. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JrGN10As8qI/Vz1601vTpCI/AAAAAAABIoM/VQW9BDfUbZUIicy-l29bu-C_vcb84NmEQCLcB/s1600/im3scbages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Laws of karma do NOT\napply to animals as they do NOT have an ego. Ego is the soul\u2019s worst\nenemy.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4rmomFHVYow/Vz18R8rJgvI/AAAAAAABIoY/fuBNKknMcCQl7iuAYu_5tT-405j8tgyMgCLcB/s1600/igggbmages.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE HUMAN SOUL WHEN IT\nSHOOTS UP TO THE SEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER OF BRAHMAN TRAVELS FASTER THAN LIGHT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Digression:-<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">IN DEEP OCEAN TSUNAMI\nWAVES ( SOLITON ) TRAVEL AT AROUND 1000 KM PER HOUR.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;ONLY\nWHEN IT REACHES SHALLOW WATERS IT SLOWS DOWN.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The speed of the\ntsunami decreases as it enters shallower water, but the height of the wave\ngrows.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Tsunamis may reach a\nmaximum vertical height onshore above sea level, called a run-up height, of 30\nmeters.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">A notable exception is the landslide generated tsunami in Lituya Bay,\nAlaska in 1958 which produced a 525 meter wave.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rkj1Wx2v3TM/VzmuAqpVHNI/AAAAAAABIfg/fJTU4k8f57k_FnB4kLTgX78bzHiYoYTtgCLcB/s1600/Lituya_Bay_megatsunami_dddiagram_%2528English%2529.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"378\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rkj1Wx2v3TM/VzmuAqpVHNI/AAAAAAABIfg/fJTU4k8f57k_FnB4kLTgX78bzHiYoYTtgCLcB/s640/Lituya_Bay_megatsunami_dddiagram_%2528English%2529.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">DAMS MUST NEVER BE\nCONSTRUCTED IN AREAS OF EARTH CRUST &nbsp;FAULTS\nWHERE THE WATER HELD BY THE RESERVOIR EXERT PRESSURE ON FAULT LINES <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Induced seismicity\nrefers to typically minor earthquakes that are caused by dam reservoirs built\nat the wrong place which cause stresses and strains on the Earth's crust.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">We all know about the\nLatur earthquake. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">We heard of the earthquake\nwas due to Koyna dam reservoir-triggered seismic activity<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The 6.6 magnitude 1967\nKoynanagar earthquake occurred in Maharashtra with its epicenter, fore- and\naftershocks all located near or under the Koyna Dam reservoir. &nbsp;More than 310 people died . The effects of the\nearthquake were felt 235 km away in Mumbai tremors and power outages. More than\n80% of the houses were damaged in Koyana Nagar Township, cracking the dam .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">In these reservoirs,\nthe weight of the water column can significantly change the stress on an\nunderlying fault or fracture by increasing the total stress through direct\nloading, or decreasing the effective stress through the increased pore water\npressure.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">This significant change in stress can lead to sudden movement along\nthe fault or fracture, resulting in an earthquake. Reservoir-induced seismic\nevents can be relatively large compared to other forms of induced seismicity. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">In Uttarakhand\npoliticians made money by building dams in unstable areas of the Ganges upper\nreaches<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THE PMO MUST KNOW THAT\nABOVE IS NOT FICTION.</b></span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">We in India heard about\nthe MORVI DAM breach ( Machu river ) Rajkot , Gujarat. which caused more than\n20,000 people to die. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>What are our IITs worth\n? </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Do we even know what happened\n? &nbsp;Morvi dam breach in 1979 was caused by\na soliton wave triggered by a earth quake.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">A tsunami wave has\nextremely long wave length and long period,&nbsp;\nand it is created by a an impulsive disturbance ..</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The human being cannot\nuse his 5 senses beyond the SCREEN OF MAYA ( quantum screen ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAYA pre-exists and\nco-exists with Brahman-the morphogenetic consciousness field<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Know nature to be\nMaya and the Ruler of this Maya is the brahmAn Himself.\" --<b> Svetasvatara\nUpanishad 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAYA is the veritable\nfabric of duality, and she performs this role at the behest of BrahmAn, the\nmorphogenetic consciousness field.. The Supreme God is not bound by Maya&nbsp; just as magicians do not believe the illusions\nof their own magic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The universe is filled\nwith an incomprehensible amount of energy and substance , most of which is\nimperceptible to our physical senses.&nbsp;\nRadio waves, microwaves, infrared waves and microscopic particles are\njust a few examples of the infinite aspects of reality that elude the\nperception of our 5 senses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our 5 senses serve as a\nfilter allowing us to experience only what is absolutely necessary for our\nphysical existence.&nbsp; The 5 senses create\nthe set for the stage we call our lives.&nbsp;\nThe senses squelch out , let we will have a breakdown due to excess\ninformation.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya is invisible\nand&nbsp; beyond sense-perception. No human\ncan see beyond the quantum screen .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dvaita Hinduism tells\nus about the duality of nature and existence .&nbsp;\nThese dual poles of Tamas \u2013Rajas ( Yin Yang ) are connected via\nconsciousness.&nbsp; It is about the quantum\npossibility wave vibration between two poles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This guarantees change,\ngrowth and evolution Lessening of Yin- always results in increase of Yang and\nvice versa.&nbsp; One cannot exist without the\nother and they are mutually dependant .&nbsp;\nBalance can never be permanent\u2014&nbsp;\nYin and Yang continuously devour each other \u2013 and life flows on.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lila is a way of\ndescribing all reality, including the cosmos, as the outcome of creative play\nby BrahmAn, the intelligent empty space in which the electrons in an atom whiz\naround.&nbsp; Maya may be understood as the\nphenomenal universe of perceived duality ( Dvaita Vedanta ) , a lesser\nreality-lens superimposed on the unity of BrahmAn ( Advaita Vedanta )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goal of spiritual\nenlightenment is to perceive BrahmAn and Maya and distinguish between\nthem.&nbsp;&nbsp; Conversely Maya gets destroyed\nfor a person when they perceive Brahman with transcendental knowledge.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A metaphor is also\ngiven\u2014when the reflection of Brahman falls on Maya, BrahmAn appears as God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No man can jump out of\nhis own self, so no man can go beyond the limits that have been put upon him by\nthe laws of time and space.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Albert Einstein lidted\nfrom Vedas when he said&nbsp; \"We have\nbeen all wrong.&nbsp; What we have called matter\nis energy, whose vibration has been so lowered as to be perceptible to the\nsenses.&nbsp; There is no matter.\"&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He has just quoted from\n7000 year old Vedanta ( which he was proficient in ) which clearly stated Maya,\nthe illusion often mistaken for reality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What is the difference\nbetween a quantum physicist and an ancient Indian maharishi seer ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The seer placed himself\ninside and saw outwards,&nbsp; for he has the\nperception afforded by a king sized pineal gland and 12 strand DNA to do so.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The quantum scientist\nwith a shriveled pineal gland and 2 strand DNA ( 97% junk ) with pre-conceived\nnotions pounded in by a moron Isaac Newton&nbsp;\nstood outside and peeked inside all the while scratching his head.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mystics took\nexistence for granted, and knew how to get from here to there.&nbsp; They got to see beyond the apparition of\nMAYA.&nbsp;&nbsp; The distinction between the self\nand the Universe is a false dichotomy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The physicists\ntook&nbsp; non-existence for granted, and\ntried&nbsp; to get from there to here\nstumbling badly in the process . The distinction between consciousness and\nphysical matter&nbsp; is the result of an\nunenlightened perspective.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The modern Big Bang\ncosmologists want to get the Universe out of nothing.&nbsp; It's like asking us to believe that nothing\nmade everything out of nothing. They could not understand singularity which the\nVedic seer did.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
