Then, when the situation passes, the cells\nreturn to their normal functioning.</span> </span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">At some stage in our\nlives, this continuous state creates an insurmountable barrier.&nbsp;</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/09/cellular-memory-complete-healing-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/09/cellular-memory-complete-healing-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/URUJD5NEXC8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/URUJD5NEXC8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As these memories and\nthoughts are confronted, they lose their force and emotional weight, which\nleads to greater understanding of oneself, clarity and powerful inner healing.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-bXuhzp-WKZg/VzWXvrBDBUI/AAAAAAABIVA/XqiwoAgQsl4Jq_oZKrS_LnGPx7-PhJK8ACLcB/s1600/ima66nges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-bXuhzp-WKZg/VzWXvrBDBUI/AAAAAAABIVA/XqiwoAgQsl4Jq_oZKrS_LnGPx7-PhJK8ACLcB/s320/ima66nges.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stages 4, 5 and 6 are\nat a much more advanced level, and it will be a waste of time to attempt them\nif the first three stages have not been practised extensively first. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stage 4, awareness and\ndisposal of spontaneous thoughts, is a refinement of previous stages. By this\ntime much negativity and many disturbing thoughts will have been cleared. The\nmind is calmer by this stage. The thoughts will be of a different quality,\narising from a deeper or more subtle space. A new dimension of one's being can\nbe indicated or revealed here, the psychic level.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One should not become\nattached to what arises. Detachment is required in order not to become\ndistracted. When one is heading inwards, into uncharted territory, the witness\nmust be strong. Gradually the mind becomes more refined and lucid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In stage 5, the aim is\nto create a state of thoughtlessness. &nbsp;No\nthoughts, the mind has to become blank whilst alertness or awareness is still\nmaintained. It is like a mental vacuum, but it is not sleep. It is shoonya. &nbsp;&nbsp;This stage leads to actual antar mouna and\nshould arise almost spontaneously as a result of having practised and perfected\nthe previous stages. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suppression takes\nplace here sometimes, but the thoughts have become almost insignificant. When\nstage 5 is easy, then one is instructed to move on to stage 6, otherwise the\nmind can become lost in laya, unconsciousness or sleep.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stage 6 is awareness of\nthe psychic symbol. Here constant awareness of the chosen psychic symbol is\nrequired, in order not to be side-tracked by other psychic scenery. At this\nstage one can slide towards the state of dharana and even dhyana.</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Below: The LYING white historian has dated Patanjali in 400 AD.&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Patanjali Yoga Sutras were penned down in 5000 BC</span></b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-I-45apeXCJE/VzWkQzxrFvI/AAAAAAABIVk/R1NoVK9X9TkWdVC-hyzBJVHN45-sF0X_ACLcB/s1600/Patanjttali.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"442\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-I-45apeXCJE/VzWkQzxrFvI/AAAAAAABIVk/R1NoVK9X9TkWdVC-hyzBJVHN45-sF0X_ACLcB/s640/Patanjttali.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the mind is under\ncontrol (vashikara), then that mind can be used as an instrument to explore the\nsubtler components of the mind field, including the samskaras themselves, which\nare the deep impressions driving KARMA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the mind is\nreasonably stabilized and clear , the deeper process of Yoga can begin. The\nmind eventually becomes like a transparent crystal , and is a purified tool for\nthe subtler explorations of the gross and subtle levels. Such a mind can\nexplore the whole range of objects, even the smallest or largest<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The key to breaking the\ncycle of karma is that the connection between \"seer\" and that which\nis \"seen\" is set aside . This allows one to avoid even the future\nkarmas that have not yet manifested .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ignorance, or avidya, is the cause of\nthis alliance, and eliminating this ignorance is the means of ending the\nalliance . This, in turn, breaks the cycle of karma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The eight rungs or\nlimbs of Yoga are exponded in Patanjali\u2019s yoga sutras.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The art and science of\nYoga is systematically described in eight (ashta) rungs, steps, or limbs\n(anga). Thus, this section of the Yoga Sutras is also called Ashtanga Yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reason for\npracticing the eight rungs of Yoga is to develop attention as the tool for\ndiscriminative knowledge, which is the means to discriminative enlightenment\nand liberation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It means using razor-like attention &nbsp;to separate the seer and the seen , so as to\nbreak the alliance of KARMA , and to get past the four mistakes of ignorance,\nor avidya, which are: 1) confusing the temporary for the eternal, 2) the impure\nfor the pure, 3) misery for happiness, and 4) the false self for the true Self .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Resulting from this systematic discrimination, the seer or Self is eventually\nexperienced in its true nature <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If it is razor-like\nattention that is the tool for discrimination, then it is the first five rungs\nof the Yoga Sutras which are honing the edge of that razor. Then, the finer,\nsharpened tool is the last three rungs, which are concentration, meditation,\nand samadhi, which are collectively called samyama<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Discrimination is a\nprocess of sorting out between this and that. This sorting out process may\nbegin at the most external level of our relationship with the world, such as in\npracticing principles such as non-injury or truthfulness .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It may include\npurifying the gross colorings of the mind , or the more subtle colorings . Over\nand over, this razor sharp discrimination cuts ever deeper into the levels of\nfalse identities &nbsp;habitually clouding the\ntrue Self <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through the repeated\nprocess of attaining discriminative knowledge through those many gross, subtle,\nand subtler levels of our being , comes discriminative enlightenment . It is an\nongoing process of discriminating between Self and non-Self, until the Self is\nseen to stand alone<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As that discriminative\nknowledge unfolds , there is a tremendous amount of insight or wisdom that\ncomes. Though it is not realistic to count them all, Patanjali states that\nseven types of ultimate insight come as a result of the intense practice of\ndiscrimination through the rungs of Yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga is rooted in the\nnotion of developing a positive personality. Therefore ethical discipline or\nthe practice of correct conduct is necessary for success in yoga. This is the\nbasis of yama and niyama, the two moral backbones of yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UrD8TMmUGN8/VzWjdYZvdsI/AAAAAAABIVU/4-__hqWOgv0sI8mKAjYI9KeqriwkwbUigCLcB/s1600/yoga-and-meditation-lvvecture-6-728.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-UrD8TMmUGN8/VzWjdYZvdsI/AAAAAAABIVU/4-__hqWOgv0sI8mKAjYI9KeqriwkwbUigCLcB/s640/yoga-and-meditation-lvvecture-6-728.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first two of &nbsp;eight rungs or limbs are the Yamas and Niyamas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yama is the first limb\nof Patanjali\u2019s ashtanga yoga and means \u2018taking a vow\u2019 while niyama is the\nsecond limb and means \u2018rule of conduct\u2019.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yama and niyama are inter-dependent.\nNiyama strengthens and safeguards yama. For example, if one is contented, one\nwill not steal, hurt others or tell lies and will find it easy to practise\nnon-covetousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When one is\nsufficiently advanced in the practices of yamas and niyamas, one can face every\ntemptation by calling in the aid of pure and restraining thoughts. When the\nmind becomes pure it attains the state of steadiness and becomes one-pointed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If these positive qualities are not cultivated, the mind cannot be led to\nsteadiness. One needs to be well established in yama-niyama to attain\nperfection in yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yama: codes of\nrestraint, abstinences, self-regulations. Yamas means sticking to ideals and\nprinciples. It is about development of positive traits that will transform the\nhuman nature into a divine nature and annihilate cravings and negative\nqualities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the yamas are truly practised, the heart is filled with cosmic\nlove, goodness and light. Ahimsa (non-violence) comes first because one must\nremove one\u2019s brutal nature first.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One must become non-violent and develop\ncosmic love. Only then does one become fit for the practice of yoga. Then comes\nsatya or truthfulness. The whole phenomenon of maya or illusion is asat or\nunreal and the aspirant should be aware of this fact. He should ever remember\nthe truth or Brahman.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Next comes asteya or non-stealing. As one must develop\nmoral consciousness, one must know right from wrong, righteousness from\nunrighteousness, and one must know that all is one.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahmacharya or continence,\nwhich is the fourth yama, is a divine attribute. The aspirant is now becoming\nsuperhuman through its practice.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fifth is aparigraha, non-covetousness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nyogic student is now free from cravings, unnecessary wants, the desire to\npossess and enjoy, and his heart has expanded manifold.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ahimsa means you also\ndo NOT approve of another\u2019s harsh actions of himsa\u2014this is part of &nbsp;ahimsa in its purest form.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Satya , truth means the\nstrength to abide by positive principles. Speak the truth, but let it not be\nunpleasant . &nbsp;Build an ethos , if you are\nestablished in truth, all other virtues will cling to you. Truth means the\nstrength to abide by positive principles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahmacharya is about\nrestraint ( avoiding looking down a plunging neckline ) and not suppression of\nsexual desire. In restraint no sexual thought will arise in the mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Parigraha is\ncovetousness or greed. Aparigraha is a mental state in which the sensual\ncraving is dead. Parigraha leads to anxiety to preserve, fear of loss, hatred,\nanger, untruthfulness, stealing, etc. Aparigraha puts an end to all these and\nbestows peace and contentment. It removes at one stroke fear, attachment,\ndisappointment, anxiety, jealousy, anger, lust and depression.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aparigraha is indeed an\naid to the practice of ahimsa, satya and asteya. When the craving is not\nsatisfied you become angry, you hate the person who stands in your way of\nattaining things. You harm him in different ways, speak untruth and begin to\nsteal things. Aparigraha removes all these. It is the foundation of all yogas,\njust as dhyana or meditation is the meeting point of all yogas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Niyama: observances,\npractices, self-training . The niyamas also consist of five limbs, namely\nshaucha, internal and external purification; santosha, contentment; tapas,\nausterity, swadhyaya, self-study and Ishwara pranidhana, surrender to divinity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shaucha is purity, both\ninternal and external. External purity generates internal purity.&nbsp; Removal of lust, anger, greed, jealousy, etc.\nconstitutes internal purity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Internal purity is more important than external\npurity. It makes the mind one-pointed, bestows serenity, cheerfulness, poise\nand happiness. It instils love, patience and magnanimity. Therefore develop\ninternal purity through vigilant effort.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Santosha or contentment cuts at the\nroot of all desires. It bestows peace, one-pointedness of mind, serenity and\nsatisfaction. It brings success in the practice of yamas. Contentment does not\nmean satisfaction, but willingness to accept things as they are and to make the\nbest of them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Divine light will\ndescend in a contented mind alone. A contented person is satisfied with his\nlot. He is happy in whatever condition he is placed, he does not crave for\nthings he does not have.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contentment is a mystic stream of joy that cools the\nthree fires of samsara and joins with the ocean of immortal bliss. The mind is\nalways restless on account of greed. Greed is a kind of internal fire that\nconsumes one slowly.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contentment is a powerful antidote for the poison of\ngreed. It is said that there are four sentinels that guard the domain of\nmoksha: shanti or peace, santosha or contentment, satsanga or company of truth\nand vichara or enquiry. It you can approach any of these sentinels you can get\nhold of the other three.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tapas means austerity\nor even practice of penance. A yogi of tapas is brilliant like a blazing fire.\nTapas also means restraint of the senses and meditation. It leads to control of\nthe mind. Austerities like occasional fasting and observance of silence\nincrease the power of endurance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mental tapas is more\npowerful than physical tapas. He who bears heat and cold does physical tapas.\nHe increases his power of endurance, but he may not be able to bear insult. He\nwill be easily upset by a harsh or unkind word for he has disciplined only the\nphysical body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To keep a balanced mind in all conditions of life, to bear\ninsult, injury and persecutions, to be ever serene, contented and peaceful, to\nbe cheerful in adverse conditions, to have fortitude in meeting danger, to have\npresence of mind and forbearance, are forms of mental tapas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swadhyaya or self-study\nis not just study of scriptures and books written by the realized ones, but\nalso enquiry into the nature of the self. Swadhyaya is asking the question,\n\u201cWho am I?\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swadhyaya is indirect\nsatsang. When you cannot get the direct company of the realized and the wise,\nswadhyaya clears doubts and strengthens the flickering faith. It fills the mind\nwith sattwa, inspires and elevates the mind, helps in concentration and\nmeditation, cuts new positive grooves in the mind and makes the mind run in\nthese grooves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ishwara pranidhana:\nSurrender to God is Ishwara pranidhana. This is the practice where the devotee\nconsecrates everything to the higher force. He no longer has a will of his own.\nHe says, \u201cI am thine. All is thine. Thy will be done. I am an instrument in\nyour hands.\u201d Self-surrender is regarding every work as that of the Supreme Lord\nand renouncing all claims to its fruits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In surrendering his\nwill to the Divine the devotee\u2019s will becomes one with the cosmic will. He\nbecomes one with the Lord. There is no loss in surrendering one\u2019s will to God.\nSelf-surrender makes the devotee feel the reality of divine grace and the\nLord\u2019s readiness to bestow help on him at all times. The divine influence\nstreams into his being and moulds it to make it a fit medium for divine\nrealization and divine instrumentality.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fsfKzHjEJ6c/VzWjxYrtIJI/AAAAAAABIVY/JizNwH7Hse4vcfnj_X-3YKRz1lXoSgKggCLcB/s1600/ashtanga-yogea.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"302\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fsfKzHjEJ6c/VzWjxYrtIJI/AAAAAAABIVY/JizNwH7Hse4vcfnj_X-3YKRz1lXoSgKggCLcB/s320/ashtanga-yogea.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The third of the eight\nrungs of Yoga is Asana, or sitting posture for the later rungs. The word Asana\ncomes from the root ~as, which means \"to sit\". Two essentials for\nposture: Yoga has been defined as the mastery of the thought patterns of mind\nfield , so that Self-realization can be experienced .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To be able to do the\nmeditation practices that allow this, it is essential that the posture be steady,\nand comfortable. The inner ear ( cochlea ) spirit level must balance ,&nbsp; for the left and right lobes of the brains to\nbe in harmony and create scalar waves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fourth of the eight\nrungs of Yoga is Pranayama, which is regulating the breath so as to make it slow\nand subtle , leading to the experience of the steady flow of energy (prana),\nwhich is beyond or underneath exhalation, inhalation, and the transitions\nbetween them .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The experience and repeated practice of this fourth pranayama\nthins the veil of KARMA, which usually clouds the inner light, allowing that to\ncome shining through<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/pranayama-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/pranayama-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tt-SPIObPnc/VzWsxYSqNPI/AAAAAAABIWI/TQGPOH3DVFgrec5FJog_2ja7gi7tP0YkgCLcB/s1600/idmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tt-SPIObPnc/VzWsxYSqNPI/AAAAAAABIWI/TQGPOH3DVFgrec5FJog_2ja7gi7tP0YkgCLcB/s400/idmages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pratyahara is the\nwithdrawal of the senses (indriyas) of cognition and action from both the\nexternal world and the images or impressions in the mind field . The senses are\nsaid to follow the mind in the same way the hive of bees follows the queen bee.\nWherever she goes, they will follow. Similarly, if the mind truly goes inward,\nthe senses will come racing behind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pratyahara is rung 5 of the 8 rungs. Our\nsenses seem to drag us around in the external world, whether pursuing material\nobjects, food, or circumstances related to professional, social, or economic\nlife. Through the routine practice of pratyahara at daily meditation time, we\ngradually gain positive control over the mind being obsessively drawn towards\nall of those objects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/01/shambhavi-mudra-bypassing-amygdala-by.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/01/shambhavi-mudra-bypassing-amygdala-by.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The last three rungs of\nYoga: Dharana (concentration), dhyana (meditation), and samadhi are the final\nthree rungs of Yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dharana: Concentration\nis the process of holding or fixing the attention of mind onto one object or\nplace. Attention leads to concentration (dharana)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dhyana: Meditation is\nsustained concentration, whereby the attention continues to hold or repeat the\nsame object or place. Concentration leads to meditation (dhyana)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KqFLThXwrc8/VzWsk7mNxMI/AAAAAAABIWA/6Ey4_n62LW4UuTPKAd8Xp6NwdQXPNnNowCLcB/s1600/imagedds.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KqFLThXwrc8/VzWsk7mNxMI/AAAAAAABIWA/6Ey4_n62LW4UuTPKAd8Xp6NwdQXPNnNowCLcB/s400/imagedds.jpg\" width=\"388\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samadhi: Samadhi is the\ndeep absorption, wherein only the essence of that object, place, or point\nshines forth in the mind, as if the mind were devoid even of its own form. Meditation\nleads to absorption (samadhi)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samyama is the collective\npractice &nbsp;of concentration , meditation ,\nand samadhi , which are the sixth, seventh, and eighth of the eight rungs of\nYoga. &nbsp;&nbsp;The three processes of dharana,\ndhyana, and samadhi, when taken together on the same object, place or point is\ncalled samyama.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The primary purpose of\nall the preparation work and the first five rungs of Yoga is to build this tool\ncalled samyama. &nbsp;&nbsp;Samyama is like the\nsurgeon's scalpel, the razor sharp tool of discrimination &nbsp;that is used for the deep introspection, which\neventually uncovers the jewel of the Self, in the core of our being.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the\ninner light dawns through samyama , it is used to examine the stages of subtle\nobjects, whether normally veiled or far away. The finest discrimination finally\nleads to liberation <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6b4ifTCZilE/VzWkAfjLILI/AAAAAAABIVc/RVsRuM4H0qAbz96CDz4JJ4aNKqjdcDGzwCLcB/s1600/the-art-scienhce-of-yoga-3-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6b4ifTCZilE/VzWkAfjLILI/AAAAAAABIVc/RVsRuM4H0qAbz96CDz4JJ4aNKqjdcDGzwCLcB/s640/the-art-scienhce-of-yoga-3-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise-part-2-capt.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/01/yoga-only-complete-exercise-part-2-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/08/ashtanga-vinyasa-yoga-vagus-nerve.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'times new roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/08/ashtanga-vinyasa-yoga-vagus-nerve.html</a><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Below: Ashtanga grandmaster Pattabhi Jois -closing ceremony</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/HhcLd3SD4n4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/HhcLd3SD4n4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Pata\u00f1jali divided his\nYoga Sutras into four chapters or books (Sanskrit pada), containing in all 196\naphorisms, divided as follows:<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Samadhi Pada--(51\nsutras). Samadhi refers to a blissful state where the yogi is absorbed into the\nOne. Samadhi is the main technique the yogin learns by which to dive into the\ndepths of the mind to achieve Kaivalya. The author describes yoga and then the\nnature and the means to attaining sam\u0101dhi. This chapter contains the famous\ndefinitional verse: \"Yoga\u015b citta-vritti-nirodha\u1e25\" (\"Yoga is the\nrestraint of mental modifications\").<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Sadhana Pada(55\nsutras). Sadhana is the Sanskrit word for \"practice\" or\n\"discipline\". Here the author outlines two forms of Yoga: Kriya Yoga\n(Action Yoga) and Ashtanga Yoga (Eightfold or Eightlimbed Yoga).<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Kriya Yoga is closely\nrelated to Karma Yoga, which is also expounded in Chapter 3 of the Bhagavad\nGita, where Arjuna is encouraged by Krishna to act without attachment to the\nresults or fruit of action and activity. It is the yoga of selfless action and\nservice.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Ashtanga Yoga describes\nthe eight limbs that together constitute R\u0101ja Yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-RAc2UbVQgpY/VzWtERNcpsI/AAAAAAABIWQ/Ygnkxj6-q0EwgO4tI-AmRBVrG6c_vdnmgCLcB/s1600/i7jdmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-RAc2UbVQgpY/VzWtERNcpsI/AAAAAAABIWQ/Ygnkxj6-q0EwgO4tI-AmRBVrG6c_vdnmgCLcB/s400/i7jdmages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Vibhuti Pada--(56\nsutras). Vibhuti is the Sanskrit word for \"power\" or\n\"manifestation\". 'Supra-normal powers' (Sanskrit: siddhi) are\nacquired by the practice of yoga. Combined simultaneous practice of Dh\u0101ra\u1e47\u0101,\nDhyana and Sam\u0101dhi is referred to as Samyama, and is considered a tool of\nachieving various perfections, or Siddhis. The temptation of these powers\nshould be avoided and the attention should be fixed only on liberation. The\npurpose of using samadhi is not to gain siddhis but to achieve Kaivalya.\nSiddhis are but distractions from Kaivalaya and are to be discouraged. Siddhis\nare but maya, or illusion.<o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8qnbpZUW6TM/VzWtUWosYoI/AAAAAAABIWY/W2qBI2B2N64sT8WS1hF_0gjqruIsdL5VwCLcB/s1600/imaccges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8qnbpZUW6TM/VzWtUWosYoI/AAAAAAABIWY/W2qBI2B2N64sT8WS1hF_0gjqruIsdL5VwCLcB/s400/imaccges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Kaivalya Pada- (34\nsutras). Kaivalya literally means \"isolation\", but as used in the\nSutras stands for emancipation or liberation and is used interchangeably with\nmoksha (liberation), which is the goal of yoga. The Kaivalya Pada describes the\nprocess of liberation and the reality of the transcendental ego.</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-unzihFY01Qc/VzWsBeHPRgI/AAAAAAABIV4/cm_pz9_SqiIfBja7Zt5Hd48AZ-1PyNtTACLcB/s1600/krishdna-gita1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-unzihFY01Qc/VzWsBeHPRgI/AAAAAAABIV4/cm_pz9_SqiIfBja7Zt5Hd48AZ-1PyNtTACLcB/s640/krishdna-gita1.jpg\" width=\"448\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>Below: &nbsp; These yoga sutras were penned down in 5000 BC -- &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>Krishna recited some of these yoga sutras to Arjuna on Kurikshetra battle field in 4000 BC</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>--when the white men was running around naked , doing GRUNT GRUNT for language.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Yet the BASTARD white invader called us savages !</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>This video is nearly &nbsp;FOUR HOURS long, listen to it and feel proud to be an Indian.</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/5MhVXHwtaWw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/5MhVXHwtaWw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>Below: &nbsp;Sanskrit chanting starts as 5.0- &nbsp; listen with head phones, it has a SCALAR healing effect.&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XsSRrsrbLc8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/XsSRrsrbLc8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sukshma sharira, or the\nastral body in the doctrine of karma, is known as a samskara, the latent\nimpression embedded in your life. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Bhagavad\nGita, The subtle ( pranic )&nbsp; body is\ncomposed of mind ( manas ) , intelligence ( buddhi ) and ego ( ahankara ) ,\nwhich controls the gross physical body<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rf78e3RVqzc/VzXOjt0dPiI/AAAAAAABIXQ/mzFR6M_qxucK_H-Z_W4smDgTY6CZAz7QwCLcB/s1600/imdages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"280\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rf78e3RVqzc/VzXOjt0dPiI/AAAAAAABIXQ/mzFR6M_qxucK_H-Z_W4smDgTY6CZAz7QwCLcB/s400/imdages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vijnanamaya encompasses\nintuition and intellect. It can be thought of as the witness mind, or that\naspect of our consciousness that is not entangled in what we are doing or\nthinking, but rather, acutely aware of what we are doing and thinking.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RF-ji67qJjo/VzXN70ciilI/AAAAAAABIXA/6xGDiclTRwMRLJrbj4oSYXVX6VBKxJa8wCLcB/s1600/imaga4es.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RF-ji67qJjo/VzXN70ciilI/AAAAAAABIXA/6xGDiclTRwMRLJrbj4oSYXVX6VBKxJa8wCLcB/s1600/imaga4es.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vijnanamaya kosha is awareness, simply put. When you\u2019ve reached the point in\nyour yoga practice where you are much less distracted by random thoughts or\noccurrences and much less caught up in the anticipation of the next posture,\nyou find that you are more able to feel the pose.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You know what is happening in\nyour body and your mind as you settle into the posture, noticing the nuances.\nThis awareness is achieved when vijnanamaya kosha is properly developed.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WI5eD1DPAnI/VzXOWWN9UgI/AAAAAAABIXI/0NB7OyQjIgEq5hUwgpg9cs68ePozmJMHwCLcB/s1600/imag8ses.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"125\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WI5eD1DPAnI/VzXOWWN9UgI/AAAAAAABIXI/0NB7OyQjIgEq5hUwgpg9cs68ePozmJMHwCLcB/s400/imag8ses.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once\nwe are able to fully engage vijnanamaya kosha, we will experience a deeper\npeace in our lives that comes by way of freedom from thoughts, actions, and\nspeech that does not serve us.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-z0LzAXdeS8Y/VzXO14W14lI/AAAAAAABIXU/2QZhNiGUyVAbsD0cPS_MVjfMwh_IGAdjwCLcB/s1600/image8ls.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"301\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-z0LzAXdeS8Y/VzXO14W14lI/AAAAAAABIXU/2QZhNiGUyVAbsD0cPS_MVjfMwh_IGAdjwCLcB/s400/image8ls.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vijnanamaya kosha (the psychic body) is the\ndimension of our personality which is operating on the astral plane. This is\nthe body experienced during dreaming, out of body experiences, and the various\ntypes of psychic phenomena.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/--HdHiP0ry3c/VzXLbMVlemI/AAAAAAABIWs/lApZc71SlvswuynQyiS1xxhFO64b0br7QCLcB/s1600/classical-yogda-21-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/--HdHiP0ry3c/VzXLbMVlemI/AAAAAAABIWs/lApZc71SlvswuynQyiS1xxhFO64b0br7QCLcB/s640/classical-yogda-21-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meditation is one way\nwe can stop fighting with ourselves, stop struggling with our circumstances and\nstop splitting ourselves, our body and our world into wanted and unwanted, avowed\nand disavowed, good and bad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It aims to internalise\nthe senses so that we can observe the underlying structure of mind.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our increasingly\nstressful society, dished out mental tensions, which manifest as anxiety,\nnervousness, guilt, lack of self-confidence, loneliness, fear, obsessions and\nphobias.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-trT4pT7XotA/VzXNsD4MspI/AAAAAAABIW8/3CJs6BoJHGop8Xx80dbdXqfqEkF7g_7CgCLcB/s1600/ffgmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"224\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-trT4pT7XotA/VzXNsD4MspI/AAAAAAABIW8/3CJs6BoJHGop8Xx80dbdXqfqEkF7g_7CgCLcB/s400/ffgmages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some turn to drugs and\nalcohol as a temporary means of escape and solace.&nbsp;&nbsp; Others enlist the costly help of\npsychiatrists or psychotherapists to try and cope.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All are looking for some form of change, a\nlittle relief from the inner conflicts and turmoil, wanting to feel at ease\nwith themselves, or even to experience, if not bliss, just a modicum of peace\nand contentment.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Single holy book religions are of no use as they can only\nsuppress. Only spirituality rooted Sanatana Dharma can extirpate ..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/--VHU40t9ESQ/VzXNdBLgrbI/AAAAAAABIW4/GVHNJnMsq8w5IvFdJqjlNkwFA0ftbnjGACLcB/s1600/downlo8kad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/--VHU40t9ESQ/VzXNdBLgrbI/AAAAAAABIW4/GVHNJnMsq8w5IvFdJqjlNkwFA0ftbnjGACLcB/s400/downlo8kad.jpg\" width=\"327\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every single suppressed\nthought that remains unexpressed causes a block in the free flow of the mind.\nThe thoughts and experiences stay submerged in the subconscious realms of the\nmind in seed form, causing pain, unhappiness and frustration in life.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These\nsubtle impressions are samskaras. Without even realizing it, we build up a vast\naccumulation of suppressed thoughts which cause a lot of tension and\ndisturbances in the mind and personality without obvious cause.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1nu-b7zvIuM/VzXQ51WCqPI/AAAAAAABIXo/3_KI1_GXAqo8DWLGX1UBLUam5gLhcs22QCLcB/s1600/imafdfges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1nu-b7zvIuM/VzXQ51WCqPI/AAAAAAABIXo/3_KI1_GXAqo8DWLGX1UBLUam5gLhcs22QCLcB/s400/imafdfges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Antar mouna enables us\nto exhaust these unwanted thoughts; it provides a means to purge the mind.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once these mental tensions start to be\nreleased, we can experience corresponding surges of energy and inspiration and\nlife starts to take on a new dimension.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_qfC3Nyekjw/VzXRb7dBfII/AAAAAAABIXw/ikeI0aNOTRw_10pd3C67ibEzIPZ6F46AACLcB/s1600/imagwes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_qfC3Nyekjw/VzXRb7dBfII/AAAAAAABIXw/ikeI0aNOTRw_10pd3C67ibEzIPZ6F46AACLcB/s400/imagwes.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Antar mouna is the\ntechnique of inner silence, also known as witnessing. &nbsp; With this technique</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;we can learn in order to maintain the path, in order\nto maintain an awareness of duality and polarity, and to be able to hold the\nnegative as well as the positive experiences.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MrtJmriiPnc/VzXQnaVVA_I/AAAAAAABIXk/4VSX_GNb8t8JhKBnTeqLNgM2-4vPJgUzwCLcB/s1600/Cycle-of-Karsgma.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MrtJmriiPnc/VzXQnaVVA_I/AAAAAAABIXk/4VSX_GNb8t8JhKBnTeqLNgM2-4vPJgUzwCLcB/s400/Cycle-of-Karsgma.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 27 , BELOW-</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/05/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_13.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/05/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_13.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
